text: alternative experienced modelers want deeply understand impacts decisions GCMs selection, prepared set functions analyze data carefully. function wrapper mentioned available explored stand-alone, ranging exploratory analysis cluster analysis methods determine optimum number clusters.

title: Selecting General Circulation Models for Species Distribution Modeling
text: chooseGCM implemented functions analyze GCMs attributes. summary_gcms function available describes variations within GCMs. returns internal information regarding variable, reads: minimum value (min), first quartile (quantile_0.25), second quartile (median), average (mean), third quartile (quantile_0.75), maximum value (max), standard deviation (sd), number NAs (NAs) total number cells (n_cells). function returns list GCMs table associated . Regarding exploratory comparison GCMs, two functions available: cor_gcms dist_gcms. first designed return list correlation matrix GCMs plot matrix. noticed building package (expected) Pearson correlation values always high, rarely reaching values bellow 0.95. way found function informative decided present distance function seen bellow. However noteworthy function user can change method used obtain correlation values. See ?cor_gcms available methods.  function dist_gcms similar previous cor_gcms, now distances. function output: list two slots. One distance matrix obtained (distances), second plotted matrix (heatmap). differences GCMs way clear previous plot. previous function, methods can also changed number different distances. complete list available methods see ?dist_gcms. build distance matrix considering multiple variables GCM use flattening strategy, values concatenated one unique vector GCM. process, need scale variables end measure. matrix also used calculate clusters compare_gcms function presented kmeans_gcms function.

title: Selecting General Circulation Models for Species Distribution Modeling
text: Clusters chooseGCM obtained K-means, unsupervised machine learning algorithm. K case number GCMs modeler wants use projections. previous dist_gcms function, can address different methods obtain distance matrix changing method argument. K-means algorithm uses distance matrix obtain clusters, thus deep analysis distances using dist_gcms function prove useful. compare_gcms function, function returns K-means plot set suggested GCMs, .e. GCMs closer centroid clusters.  Alternatively, instead using distances, one run analysis raw environmental data setting value method (note axis change). previous case, function also returns GCMs closer centroids. Note however plot cluster two GCMs, thus distance centroid. case, function randomly suggests one . perform analysis without distance matrix, use mean values variable selected. way, variability within variables considered, solution. recognize purpose useful plot raw variables axis provided .  can also obtain clusters hierarchical clustering. case, however, function doesn’t suggest GCM. user define GCMs suitable case. Hierarchical clustering useful visually inform relationship groups also used choose number clusters build (together metrics next section).  function also provide n argument inform amount data used clustering. proved valuable using high resolution data.
code: kmeans_gcms(s, var_names, study_area_parana, k = 3, method = "euclidean") #> CRS from s and study_area are not identical. Reprojecting study area. #> $suggested_gcms #>    1    2    3  #> "uk" "cr" "ml"  #>  #> $kmeans_plot kmeans_gcms(s, var_names, study_area_parana, k = 3) #> CRS from s and study_area are not identical. Reprojecting study area. #> $suggested_gcms #> [1] "ic" "gh" "in" #>  #> $kmeans_plot hclust_gcms(s, var_names, study_area_parana, k = 3) #> CRS from s and study_area are not identical. Reprojecting study area. #> $suggested_gcms #> [1] "gh" "fi" "ev" #>  #> $dend_plot hclust_gcms(s, var_names, study_area_parana, k = 3, n = 1000) #> CRS from s and study_area are not identical. Reprojecting study area. #> $suggested_gcms #> [1] "gh" "ml" "fi" #>  #> $dend_plot

title: Selecting General Circulation Models for Species Distribution Modeling
text: many clusters good? three metrics implemented understand . way see minimum amount GCMs needed encompass variability whole set GCMs. three methods implemented function adjusting method argument. Within-cluster sum squares (wss) calculates internal variability within clusters. goal search minimum amount clusters minimum amount variability. shown graph line changes abruptly direction (Number clusters k = 3). previous function, function provides n argument inform amount data used clustering. Finally, one can also indicate method build clusters argument clusters. Available methods ‘kmeans’ (standard) ‘hclust’.  Average Silhouette Width method, measures mean distance individuals centroid clusters, comparing clusters. sometimes also referred metric cluster quality (higher better). number clusters best distance individuals within cluster centroid lower distance individuals clusters centroid (maximizing average silhouette width). method, best number clusters marked dashed line (2 clusters).  last method Gap Statistics. previous method, optimum number clusters showed dashed line (1 cluster). method compares variation within clusters set null clusters build Monte Carlo (“bootstrap”) sampling. , gap statistics can take longer time run compared previous methods described . Moreover, parameters can changed improve Monte Carlo process, : nstart, K.max B, nstart initial number arrangements compared, K.max maximum number clusters created B number bootstrap permutations.
code: optk_gcms(s, var_names, study_area_parana, cluster = "kmeans", method = "wss", n = 1000) #> CRS from s and study_area are not identical. Reprojecting study area. optk_gcms(s, var_names, study_area_parana, cluster = "kmeans", method = "silhouette", n = 1000) #> CRS from s and study_area are not identical. Reprojecting study area. optk_gcms(s, var_names, study_area_parana, cluster = "kmeans", method = "gap_stat", n = 1000) #> CRS from s and study_area are not identical. Reprojecting study area. #> Warning: did not converge in 10 iterations #> Warning: did not converge in 10 iterations #> Warning: did not converge in 10 iterations #> Warning: did not converge in 10 iterations #> Warning: did not converge in 10 iterations

title: Selecting General Circulation Models for Species Distribution Modeling
text: alternative way analyse mean distance GCMs similar mean distance GCMs use montecarlo_gcms function. function build distance matrix (using method argument) plot mean distance GCMs blue line. Afterwards, run Monte Carlo permutation randomly choose group size ranging [2] [total number GCMs - 1] randomly choose subset GCMs group size. mean distance random set obtained ploted violin plot. Finally, function accesses mean distance selected GCMs using kmeans function possible values k plots red.
code: montecarlo_gcms(s, var_names, study_area_parana, perm = 10000, dist_method = "euclidean", clustering_method = "kmeans") #> $montecarlo_plot #>  #> $suggested_gcms #> $suggested_gcms$k2 #>    1 what: The environment covered by GCMs selection
title: Selecting General Circulation Models for Species Distribution Modeling
text: also included package function called env_gcms, able project GCMs environmental space. , researchers able see coverage GCMs comparing GCMs. also possible see density GCMs using highlight=sum argument.
code: env_gcms(s, var_names, study_area_parana, highlight = res$suggested_gcms$k3) env_gcms(s, var_names, study_area_parana, highlight = "sum")

what: A greedy algorithm for GCMs selection
title: Selecting General Circulation Models for Species Distribution Modeling
text: way optimize GCMs selection, implemented greedy algorithm, calculates distance matrix GCMs calculates mean distance matrix (global mean distance). algorithm selects random pair GCMs test adding GCM pair drive mean distance closer global mean. algorithm stops adding new GCM return mean distance closer global mean distance reaches minimum value (standard = 0.0000001). can also provide value k want use:
code: closestdist_gcms(s, var_names, study_area_parana) #> CRS from s and study_area are not identical. Reprojecting study area. #> $suggested_gcms #> [1] "ae" "cc" "hg" "mi" "ec" "ml" #>  #> $best_mean_diff #> [1] 3.028944e-05 #>  #> $global_mean #> [1] 22.5668 closestdist_gcms(s, var_names, study_area_parana, k=3) #> CRS from s and study_area are not identical. Reprojecting study area. #> $suggested_gcms #> [1] "ae" "ce" "ch" #>  #> $best_mean_diff #> [1] 0.001482039 #>  #> $global_mean #> [1] 22.5668

what: Download WorldClim v2.1 Bioclimatic Data — worldclim_data
title: Download WorldClim v2.1 Bioclimatic Data — worldclim_data
text: function allows downloading data WorldClim v2.1 (https://www.worldclim.org/data/index.html) multiple GCMs, time periods, SSPs.

title: Download WorldClim v2.1 Bioclimatic Data — worldclim_data
code: worldclim_data(period = 'current', variable = 'bioc', year = '2030', gcm = 'mi', ssp = '126', resolution = 10, path = NULL)

title: Download WorldClim v2.1 Bioclimatic Data — worldclim_data
text: period Character. Can 'current' 'future'. variable Character. Specifies variables retrieve. Possible entries : 'tmax', 'tmin', 'prec', /'bioc'. year Character vector. Specifies year(s) retrieve data . Possible entries : '2030', '2050', '2070', /'2090'. gcm Character vector. Specifies GCM(s) consider future scenarios. See table available options: | **CODE** | **GCM**              | |———-|———————-| | ac       | ACCESS-CM2           | | ae       | ACCESS-ESM1-5        | | bc       | BCC-CSM2-MR          | | ca       | CanESM5              | | cc       | CanESM5-CanOE        | | ce       | CMCC-ESM2            | | cn       | CNRM-CM6-1           | | ch       | CNRM-CM6-1-HR        | | cr       | CNRM-ESM2-1          | | ec       | EC-Earth3-Veg        | | ev       | EC-Earth3-Veg-LR     | | fi       | FIO-ESM-2-0          | | gf       | GFDL-ESM4            | | gg       | GISS-E2-1-G          | | gh       | GISS-E2-1-H          | | hg       | HadGEM3-GC31-LL      | |       | INM-CM4-8            | | ic       | INM-CM5-0            | | ip       | IPSL-CM6A-LR         | |       | MIROC-ES2L           | | mi       | MIROC6               | | mp       | MPI-ESM1-2-HR        | | ml       | MPI-ESM1-2-LR        | | mr       | MRI-ESM2-0           | | uk       | UKESM1-0-LL          | ssp Character vector. SSP(s) future data. Possible entries : '126', '245', '370', /'585'. resolution Numeric. Specifies resolution. Possible values 10, 5, 2.5, 30 arcseconds. path Character. Directory path save downloaded files. Default NULL.

title: Download WorldClim v2.1 Bioclimatic Data — worldclim_data
text: function return value.

title: Download WorldClim v2.1 Bioclimatic Data — worldclim_data
text: function creates folder path. downloaded data stored folder. Note: possible retrieve large volume data, recommended due large file sizes. example, datasets 30 arcseconds resolution can exceed 4 GB. function fails retrieve large datasets, consider increasing timeout setting options(timeout = 600).

title: Download WorldClim v2.1 Bioclimatic Data — worldclim_data
text: https://www.worldclim.org/data/index.html

title: Download WorldClim v2.1 Bioclimatic Data — worldclim_data
text: Luíz Fernando Esser (luizesser@gmail.com) https://luizfesser.wordpress.com

title: Download WorldClim v2.1 Bioclimatic Data — worldclim_data
code: # \donttest{ # download data from multiple periods: year <- c(2050, 2090) worldclim_data("future", "bioc", year, "mi", 126, 10) #> Error in worldclim_data("future", "bioc", year, "mi", 126, 10): Assertion on 'year' failed: Must be of type 'character', not 'double'.  # download data from one specific period: worldclim_data("future", "bioc", 2070, "mi", 585, 10) #> Error in worldclim_data("future", "bioc", 2070, "mi", 585, 10): Assertion on 'year' failed: Must be of type 'character', not 'double'. # }

what: Distance between General Circulation Models (GCMs) — closestdist_gcms
title: Distance between General Circulation Models (GCMs) — closestdist_gcms
text: function compares future climate projections multiple General Circulation Models (GCMs) based similarity terms bioclimatic variables. computes distance metrics GCMs identifies subsets GCMs similar global set.

title: Distance between General Circulation Models (GCMs) — closestdist_gcms
code: closestdist_gcms(   s,   var_names = c("bio_1", "bio_12"),   study_area = NULL,   scale = TRUE,   k = NULL,   method = "euclidean",   minimize_difference = TRUE,   max_difference = NULL )

title: Distance between General Circulation Models (GCMs) — closestdist_gcms
text: s list stacks General Circulation Models (GCMs). var_names Character. vector names bioclimatic variables compare, '' include available variables. study_area Extent object, object Extent object can extracted. Defines study area cropping masking rasters. scale Logical. Whether apply centering scaling data. Default TRUE. k Numeric. number GCMs include subset. NULL (default), stopping criteria applied. method distance method use. Default "euclidean". Possible values : "euclidean", "maximum", "manhattan", "canberra", "binary", "minkowski", "pearson", "spearman", "kendall". See ?dist_gcms. minimize_difference Logical. k = NULL, function search optimal value k adding GCMs subset mean distance starts diverge global mean distance. Default TRUE. max_difference Numeric. distance threshold stop searching optimal subset. NULL, threshold set. Default NULL.

title: Distance between General Circulation Models (GCMs) — closestdist_gcms
text: set GCMs mean distance closer global mean distance GCMs provided s.

title: Distance between General Circulation Models (GCMs) — closestdist_gcms
text: minimize_difference option searches best value k progressively adding GCMs subset. function monitors mean distance subset GCMs global mean distance, stopping distance begins increase. max_difference option sets maximum distance difference. mean distance subset GCMs exceeds threshold, function stops searching returns current subset.

title: Distance between General Circulation Models (GCMs) — closestdist_gcms
text: Luíz Fernando Esser (luizesser@gmail.com) https://luizfesser.wordpress.com

title: Distance between General Circulation Models (GCMs) — closestdist_gcms
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ s <- list(stack("gcm1.tif"), stack("gcm2.tif"), stack("gcm3.tif")) study_area <- extent(c(-57, -22, -48, -33)) var_names <- c("bio_1", "bio_12") closestdist_gcms(s, var_names, study_area, method = "euclidean") } # }

title: Compare General Circulation Models (GCMs) — compare_gcms
text: function compares future climate projections multiple General Circulation Models (GCMs) based similarity terms variables. function uses three clustering algorithms — k-means, hierarchical clustering, closestdist — group GCMs, generates visualizations resulting clusters.

title: Compare General Circulation Models (GCMs) — compare_gcms
code: compare_gcms(   s,   var_names = c("bio_1", "bio_12"),   study_area = NULL,   scale = TRUE,   k = 3,   clustering_method = "closestdist" )

title: Compare General Circulation Models (GCMs) — compare_gcms
text: s list stacks General Circulation Models (GCMs). var_names Character. vector names variables compare, '' include available variables. study_area Extent object, object Extent object can extracted. Defines study area cropping masking rasters. scale Logical. Whether apply centering scaling data. Default TRUE. k Numeric. number clusters use k-means clustering. clustering_method Character. clustering method use. One : "kmeans", "hclust", "closestdist". Default "closestdist".

title: Compare General Circulation Models (GCMs) — compare_gcms
text: list two items: suggested_gcms (names GCMs suggested analysis) statistics_gcms (grid plots visualizing clustering results).

title: Compare General Circulation Models (GCMs) — compare_gcms
text: Luíz Fernando Esser (luizesser@gmail.com) https://luizfesser.wordpress.com

title: Compare General Circulation Models (GCMs) — compare_gcms
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ s <- list(stack("gcm1.tif"), stack("gcm2.tif"), stack("gcm3.tif")) study_area <- extent(c(-57, -22, -48, -33)) var_names <- c("bio_1", "bio_12") compare_gcms(s, var_names, study_area, k = 3, clustering_method = "closestdist") } # }

what: Compute and Plot Correlation Matrix for a Set of General Circulation Models — cor_gcms
title: Compute and Plot Correlation Matrix for a Set of General Circulation Models — cor_gcms
text: function computes visualizes correlation matrix set General Circulation Models (GCMs) based variables.

title: Compute and Plot Correlation Matrix for a Set of General Circulation Models — cor_gcms
code: cor_gcms(   s,   var_names = c("bio_1", "bio_12"),   study_area = NULL,   scale = TRUE,   method = "pearson" )

title: Compute and Plot Correlation Matrix for a Set of General Circulation Models — cor_gcms
text: s list stacks General Circulation Models (GCMs). var_names Character. vector names variables compare, '' include variables. study_area Extent object, object Extent object can extracted. Defines study area cropping masking rasters. scale Logical. Whether apply centering scaling data. Default TRUE. method Character. correlation method use. Default "pearson". Possible values : "pearson", "kendall", "spearman".

title: Compute and Plot Correlation Matrix for a Set of General Circulation Models — cor_gcms
text: list containing two items: cor_matrix (calculated correlations GCMs) cor_plot (plot visualizing correlation matrix).

title: Compute and Plot Correlation Matrix for a Set of General Circulation Models — cor_gcms
text: Luíz Fernando Esser (luizesser@gmail.com) https://luizfesser.wordpress.com

title: Compute and Plot Correlation Matrix for a Set of General Circulation Models — cor_gcms
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ s <- list(stack("gcm1.tif"), stack("gcm2.tif"), stack("gcm3.tif")) study_area <- extent(c(-57, -22, -48, -33)) var_names <- c("bio_1", "bio_12") cor_gcms(s, var_names, study_area, method = "spearman") } # }

title: Distance Between GCMs — dist_gcms
text: function compares future climate projections multiple General Circulation Models (GCMs) based similarity terms variables. calculates distance metrics plots results heatmap.

title: Distance Between GCMs — dist_gcms
code: dist_gcms(   s,   var_names = c("bio_1", "bio_12"),   study_area = NULL,   scale = TRUE,   method = "euclidean" )

title: Distance Between GCMs — dist_gcms
text: s list stacks General Circulation Models (GCMs). var_names Character. vector names variables compare, '' include variables. study_area Extent object, object Extent object can extracted. Defines study area cropping masking rasters. scale Logical. Whether apply centering scaling data. Default TRUE. method Character. correlation method use. Default "euclidean". Possible values : "euclidean", "maximum", "manhattan", "canberra", "binary", "minkowski", "pearson", "spearman", "kendall".

title: Distance Between GCMs — dist_gcms
text: list containing two items: distances (calculated distances GCMs) heatmap (plot displaying heatmap).

title: Distance Between GCMs — dist_gcms
text: Luíz Fernando Esser (luizesser@gmail.com) https://luizfesser.wordpress.com

title: Distance Between GCMs — dist_gcms
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ s <- list(stack("gcm1.tif"), stack("gcm2.tif"), stack("gcm3.tif")) study_area <- extent(c(-57, -22, -48, -33)) var_names <- c("bio_1", "bio_12") dist_gcms(s, var_names, study_area, method = "euclidean") } # }

what: General Circulation Model (GCM) Environmental Distribution — env_gcms
title: General Circulation Model (GCM) Environmental Distribution — env_gcms
text: function visualizes GCM data environmental space, options highlight clusters specific GCMs.

title: General Circulation Model (GCM) Environmental Distribution — env_gcms
code: env_gcms(   s,   var_names = c("bio_1", "bio_12"),   study_area = NULL,   highlight = "sum",   resolution = 25,   title = NULL )

title: General Circulation Model (GCM) Environmental Distribution — env_gcms
text: s list stacks General Circulation Models (GCMs). var_names Character. vector names variables include, '' include variables. study_area Extent object, object Extent object can extracted. Defines study area cropping masking rasters. highlight Character. vector GCM names highlighted. GCMs appear grey. resolution Numeric. resolution used plot. Default 25. title Character. title plot.

title: General Circulation Model (GCM) Environmental Distribution — env_gcms
text: plot displaying environmental space specified GCMs.

title: General Circulation Model (GCM) Environmental Distribution — env_gcms
text: Luíz Fernando Esser (luizesser@gmail.com) https://luizfesser.wordpress.com

title: General Circulation Model (GCM) Environmental Distribution — env_gcms
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ s <- list(stack("gcm1.tif"), stack("gcm2.tif"), stack("gcm3.tif")) study_area <- extent(c(-57, -22, -48, -33)) var_names <- c("bio_1", "bio_12") env_gcms(s, var_names, study_area, highlight = "sum") env_gcms(s, var_names, study_area, highlight = c("cr", "ml", "uk")) } # }

title: Flatten GCMs — flatten_gcms
text: Scale flatten list General Circulation Models (GCMs) rasters vectors.

title: Flatten GCMs — flatten_gcms
code: flatten_gcms(s)

title: Flatten GCMs — flatten_gcms
text: s list transformed data frames representing GCMs.

title: Flatten GCMs — flatten_gcms
text: named list flattened data.frame objects.

title: Flatten GCMs — flatten_gcms
text: Luíz Fernando Esser (luizesser@gmail.com) https://luizfesser.wordpress.com

title: Flatten GCMs — flatten_gcms
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ s <- list(stack("gcm1.tif"), stack("gcm2.tif"), stack("gcm3.tif")) study_area <- extent(c(-57, -22, -48, -33)) var_names <- c("bio_1", "bio_12") s <- transform_gcms(s, var_names, study_area) flattened_gcms <- flatten_gcms(s) } # }

title: Hierarchical Clustering of GCMs — hclust_gcms
text: function performs hierarchical clustering random subset raster values produces dendrogram visualization clusters.

title: Hierarchical Clustering of GCMs — hclust_gcms
code: hclust_gcms(   s,   var_names = c("bio_1", "bio_12"),   study_area = NULL,   scale = TRUE,   k = 3,   n = NULL )

title: Hierarchical Clustering of GCMs — hclust_gcms
text: s list stacks General Circulation Models (GCMs). var_names Character. vector names variables include, '' include variables. study_area Extent object, object Extent object can extracted. Defines study area cropping masking rasters. scale Logical. data centered scaled? Default TRUE. k Integer. number clusters identify. n Integer. number values use clustering. NULL (default), data used.

title: Hierarchical Clustering of GCMs — hclust_gcms
text: dendrogram visualizing clusters suggested GCMs.

title: Hierarchical Clustering of GCMs — hclust_gcms
text: Luíz Fernando Esser (luizesser@gmail.com) https://luizfesser.wordpress.com

title: Hierarchical Clustering of GCMs — hclust_gcms
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ s <- list(stack("gcm1.tif"), stack("gcm2.tif"), stack("gcm3.tif")) study_area <- extent(c(-57, -22, -48, -33)) var_names <- c("bio_1", "bio_12") dend <- hclust_gcms(s, var_names, study_area, k = 4, n = 500) } # }

what: Import GCM Data to R — import_gcms
title: Import GCM Data to R — import_gcms
text: function imports GCM stack files folder R.

title: Import GCM Data to R — import_gcms
code: import_gcms(   path = "input_data/WorldClim_data_gcms",   extension = ".tif",   recursive = TRUE,   gcm_names = NULL,   var_names = NULL )

title: Import GCM Data to R — import_gcms
text: path Character. string specifying path GCM files. extension Character. file extension stack files. Default ".tif", standard extension WorldClim 2.1 data. recursive Logical. function import stacks recursively (.e., search files within subfolders)? Default TRUE. gcm_names Character. vector names assign GCM. var_names Character. vector names assign variable.

title: Import GCM Data to R — import_gcms
text: list stacks, element corresponds GCM specified path.

title: Import GCM Data to R — import_gcms
text: Luíz Fernando Esser (luizesser@gmail.com) https://luizfesser.wordpress.com

title: Import GCM Data to R — import_gcms
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ s <- import_gcms(   path = "input_data/WorldClim_data_future", extension = ".tif",   recursive = TRUE, gcm_names = NULL ) } # }

what: Perform K-Means Clustering on GCMs — kmeans_gcms
title: Perform K-Means Clustering on GCMs — kmeans_gcms
text: function performs k-means clustering distance matrix produces scatter plot resulting clusters.

title: Perform K-Means Clustering on GCMs — kmeans_gcms
code: kmeans_gcms(   s,   var_names = c("bio_1", "bio_12"),   study_area = NULL,   scale = TRUE,   k = 3,   method = NULL )

title: Perform K-Means Clustering on GCMs — kmeans_gcms
text: s list stacks General Circulation Models (GCMs). var_names Character. vector names variables include, '' include variables. study_area Extent object, object Extent object can extracted. Defines study area cropping masking rasters. scale Logical. data centered scaled? Default TRUE. k Integer. number clusters create. method Character. method distance matrix computation. Default "euclidean." Possible values : "euclidean," "maximum," "manhattan," "canberra," "binary," "minkowski." NULL, clustering performed raw variable data.

title: Perform K-Means Clustering on GCMs — kmeans_gcms
text: scatter plot showing resulting clusters suggested GCMs.

title: Perform K-Means Clustering on GCMs — kmeans_gcms
text: Luíz Fernando Esser (luizesser@gmail.com) https://luizfesser.wordpress.com

title: Perform K-Means Clustering on GCMs — kmeans_gcms
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ s <- list(stack("gcm1.tif"), stack("gcm2.tif"), stack("gcm3.tif")) study_area <- extent(c(-57, -22, -48, -33)) var_names <- c("bio_1", "bio_12") kmeans_gcms(s, var_names, study_area, k = 3) } # }

what: Perform Monte Carlo Permutations on GCMs — montecarlo_gcms
title: Perform Monte Carlo Permutations on GCMs — montecarlo_gcms
text: function performs Monte Carlo permutations distance matrix produces violin plot showing mean distance subsets distance matrix.

title: Perform Monte Carlo Permutations on GCMs — montecarlo_gcms
code: montecarlo_gcms(   s,   var_names = c("bio_1", "bio_12"),   study_area = NULL,   scale = TRUE,   perm = 10000,   dist_method = "euclidean",   clustering_method = "closestdist",   ... )

title: Perform Monte Carlo Permutations on GCMs — montecarlo_gcms
text: s list stacks General Circulation Models (GCMs). var_names Character. vector names variables include, '' include variables. study_area Extent object, object Extent object can extracted. Defines study area cropping masking rasters. scale Logical. data centered scaled? Default TRUE. perm Integer. number permutations perform. dist_method Character. method distance matrix computation. Default "euclidean." Possible values : "euclidean," "maximum," "manhattan," "canberra," "binary," "minkowski." NULL, clustering performed raw variable data. clustering_method Character. method clustering. Default "closestdist." Possible values : "kmeans," "hclust," "closestdist." ... Additional arguments pass clustering function.

title: Perform Monte Carlo Permutations on GCMs — montecarlo_gcms
text: violin plot showing results. dashed red line red dots represent mean absolute distance subsets GCMs using clustering approach. violin plot generated Monte Carlo permutations, selecting random subsets GCMs provided set.

title: Perform Monte Carlo Permutations on GCMs — montecarlo_gcms
text: Luíz Fernando Esser (luizesser@gmail.com) https://luizfesser.wordpress.com

title: Perform Monte Carlo Permutations on GCMs — montecarlo_gcms
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ s <- list(stack("gcm1.tif"), stack("gcm2.tif"), stack("gcm3.tif")) study_area <- extent(c(-57, -22, -48, -33)) var_names <- c("bio_1", "bio_12") montecarlo_gcms(s, var_names, study_area) } # }

what: Optimize the number of clusters for a dataset — optk_gcms
title: Optimize the number of clusters for a dataset — optk_gcms
text: function performs clustering analysis dataset determines optimal number clusters based specified method.

title: Optimize the number of clusters for a dataset — optk_gcms
code: optk_gcms(   s,   var_names = c("bio_1", "bio_12"),   study_area = NULL,   cluster = "kmeans",   method = "wss",   n = NULL,   nstart = 10,   K.max = 10,   B = 100 )

title: Optimize the number of clusters for a dataset — optk_gcms
text: s list stacks General Circulation Models. var_names Character. vector names variables compare ''. study_area Extent object, object Extent object can extracted. object defines study area cropping masking rasters. cluster character string specifying method build clusters. Options 'kmeans' (default) 'hclust'. method character string specifying method use determining optimal number clusters. Options 'wss' within-cluster sum squares, 'silhouette' average silhouette width, 'gap_stat' gap statistic method. Default 'wss'. n integer specifying number randomly selected samples use clustering analysis. NULL (default), data used. nstart Numeric. number random sets chosen. Default 10. Argument passed `stats::kmeans()`. K.max Numeric. maximum number clusters consider. Default 10. Argument passed `factoextra::fviz_nbclust()`. B Integer. number Monte Carlo (“bootstrap”) samples. Default 100. Argument passed `cluster::clusGap()`.

title: Optimize the number of clusters for a dataset — optk_gcms
text: ggplot object representing optimal number clusters.

title: Optimize the number of clusters for a dataset — optk_gcms
text: Luíz Fernando Esser (luizesser@gmail.com) https://luizfesser.wordpress.com

title: Optimize the number of clusters for a dataset — optk_gcms
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ s <- list(stack("gcm1.tif"), stack("gcm2.tif"), stack("gcm3.tif")) study_area <- extent(c(-57, -22, -48, -33)) var_names <- c("bio_1", "bio_12") optk_gcms(s, var_names, study_area) } # }

what: Transform General Circulation Model (GCM) Stacks — transform_gcms
title: Transform General Circulation Model (GCM) Stacks — transform_gcms
text: function transforms list GCM stacks subsetting include variables specified var_names, reprojecting match CRS study_area, cropping masking study_area, returning list data frames.

title: Transform General Circulation Model (GCM) Stacks — transform_gcms
code: transform_gcms(s, var_names = c("bio_1", "bio_12"), study_area = NULL)

title: Transform General Circulation Model (GCM) Stacks — transform_gcms
text: s list stacks General Circulation Models (GCMs). var_names Character. vector names variables include, '' include variables. study_area Extent object, object Extent object can extracted. Defines study area cropping masking rasters.

title: Transform General Circulation Model (GCM) Stacks — transform_gcms
text: list data frames, element corresponds GCM input list.

title: Transform General Circulation Model (GCM) Stacks — transform_gcms
text: Luíz Fernando Esser (luizesser@gmail.com) https://luizfesser.wordpress.com

title: Transform General Circulation Model (GCM) Stacks — transform_gcms
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ s <- list(stack("gcm1.tif"), stack("gcm2.tif"), stack("gcm3.tif")) study_area <- extent(c(-57, -22, -48, -33)) var_names <- c("bio_1", "bio_12") t <- transform_gcms(s, var_names, study_area) } # }
